How to Create a Virtual Installation
Your CC Host site can be configured to look like many different sites with just a few menu selections (and no changes to your web server).
Why do this? Let's say you are running a remix community as your main site but also want to run a contest (or you mainly run contests and you also want to have a personal 'media weblog' on the side -- or -- whatever).
In this case you want to have a 'virtual face' to the site without the hassle of reinstalling or major configuation hoops.
Creating a Virtual Personal Media Weblog
[note: 'pretty urls' are currently off in the alpha so the following includes all this '?mode=/' gobbledy gook in the URLs, that will go away when pretty urls are working again.]
As an example let's say you wanted a virtual site that was your own person media weblog for remixes.
1) Pick a name for the new virtual face (e.g. 'myremixes') and type into your browser like this:
${root-url}?mode=/myremixes
2) There is no step 2.
In order to customize this virtual installation select 'Setting' and pick another skin, or select Menus to change the menus.
All the configuration settings you make (except for a few things like 'Global Setup' and 'Database') will only be applied to your new virtual site. Use the url above as your 'home' url and you're on your way.
For the personal remix weblog you will probably want to restrict the menus so that only you (as admin) have the ability to upload or register so in the menu configuation you mark everything you don't want anybody to see as 'Admin only'.
Creating a Virtual Contest Site
If you run regular contests you can set up a virtual site for every contest, each with it's own skin (look and feel) and functionality (what file formats are allowed, etc.)
Here's a way to do it:
1) Create the contest and note the 'internal name' you give it (e.g. 'myfirstcontest')
2) Now create the virtual site by browsing to:
${root-url}?mode=/myfirstcontest
3) Select 'Settings' from the menu.
4) In the 'Homepage' field type the following:
contest/myfirstcontest
5) Select your skin from the drop down.
Now edit the menus to cut them down to just what you want people to see.
Other Virtual Sites
The two cases above are what we came up with. You may have a whole other set of cases.
For example, in a community setting you may chose to give each member (or selected members) the ability to customize their own pages. As administrator you can setup a virtual site for each person assigning their member's page as the home page for that virtual site and even allow them to submit a CSS skin just for their version of the site.
Because you edit the menus you can control what that user or other members see when they are looking at that virtual site.
And whatever else you can think of.
